speak.value: The 2008 Summer Olympic Games was a major international multi-sport event that took place in Beijing, China, from August 8 to 24, 2008.
Aquatics are sports played in or on water.
Archery is the sport of using a bow to propel arrows.
Athletics are sports of competing in track and field events, including running races and various competitions in jumping and throwing.
Badminton is a racquet sport played by either two opposing players (singles) or two opposing pairs (doubles), who take positions on opposite halves of a rectangular court divided by a net.
Baseball is a bat-and-ball sport played between two teams of nine players each who take turns batting and fielding.
Basketball is a sport played by two teams of five players on a rectangular court.
Boxing is a martial art and combat sport in which two people engage in a contest of strength, speed, reflexes, endurance and will, by throwing punches at each other, usually with gloved hands.
Canoeing is a paddle sports in which you kneel or sit facing forward in an open or closed-decked canoe and propel yourself with a single-bladed paddle using your own power.
Cycling is the sport of using bicycles.
Equestrian is the sport of horseback riding.
Fencing is a sport of the western art of combat with a small sword.
Football is a sport in which players kick the ball with only their feet to score a goal.
Gymnastics are sports involving the performance of exercises requiring physical strength, flexibility, power, agility, coordination, grace, balance, and control.
Handball is a team sport in which two teams of seven players each (six outfield players and a goalkeeper) pass a ball using their hands with the aim of throwing it into the goal of the other team.
Hockey is a sport in which two teams play against each other by trying to maneuver a ball or a puck into the opponent's goal using a hockey stick.
Judo is a sport in which two people fight without weapons and try to throw each other to the ground.
Modern Pentathlon is a sport that comprises five events: horse riding with jumps, fencing, freestyle swimming, pistol shooting, and cross-country running.
Rowing is the sport of propelling a boat using the motion of oars in the water.
Sailing is the sport that uses sailboats.
Shooting is a competitive sport involving tests of proficiency (accuracy and speed) using various types of guns such as firearms and airguns.
Softball is a variant of baseball played with a larger ball on a smaller field.
Table tennis is a sport in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball back and forth across a table using a small, round paddle.
Taekwondo is a Korean martial art and sport with a heavy emphasis on kicks.
Tennis is a sport in which two or four players strike a ball with rackets over a net stretched across a court.
The triathlon is a multiple-stage sport involving the completion of three continuous and sequential endurance disciplines, most popularly swimming, cycling, and running.
Volleyball is a team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a net.
Weightlifting is a sport in which the athlete attempts a maximum-weight single lift of a barbell loaded with weight plates.
Wrestling is a combat sport involving grappling type techniques such as clinch fighting, throws and takedowns, joint locks, pins, and other grappling holds.
Sports are competitive leisure activities which need physical effort and skill.
Beijing National Aquatics Center is the aquatics center that was built alongside Beijing National Stadium in the Olympic Green for the swimming competitions of the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Beijing National Indoor Stadium is the indoor arena that was constructed resembling a traditional Chinese folding fan.
Beijing National Stadium was designed for athletics events throughout the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Olympic Green Tennis Center is the tennis center that hosted the tennis preliminaries and finals of singles and doubles for men and women at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Olympic Green Archery Field, which hosted the archery events, was one of nine temporary venues for the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Olympic Green Convention Center, which covers an area of 270,000 square meters, was used for fencing in the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Olympic Green Hockey Stadium, which hosted the hockey competitions, was one of nine temporary venues for the 2008 Summer Olympics.

Feature.data: Beijing Science and Technology University Gymnasium

speak.value: Consisting of a main gym and a comprehensive facility, the Beijing Science and Technology University Gymnasium is an indoor arena located on the campus of the Beijing University of Science and Technology.
Located on the campus of the Beijing University of Technology, the Beijing University of Technology Gymnasium hosted badminton and rhythmic gymnastics events at 2008 Summer Olympics.

Located on the campus of the China Agricultural University in Beijing, the China Agricultural University Gymnasium, with staggered stair-like rooftop, hosted the wrestling events at 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Peking University Gymnasium, nicknamed China's Spine, is an indoor arena located in the southeastern part of Peking University.

Feature.data: Beijing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics Gymnasium

speak.value: Located on the campus of Beijing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, the gymnasium, a 5,400-seat indoor arena hosted weightlifting competitions at 2008 Summer Olympics.
Located on the campus of Beijing Institute of Technology, the Beijing Institute of Technology Gymnasium, a 5,000-seat indoor arena, hosted volleyball competitions at 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Beijing Shooting Range Hall hosted the qualifying rounds and finals of ten shooting events at the 2008 Summer Olympics, consisting of all 10-, 25- and 50-meter events.
The Laoshan Velodrome hosted track cycling disciplines during the Olympics with a capacity of 6,000 spectators, a 250-metre oval shaped track, and a total land surface of 32,920 square meters.
The Shunyi Olympic Rowing-Canoeing Park was built for the rowing, canoeing, and 10 km open-water swimming events in the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Wukesong Indoor Stadium is an indoor arena for the 2008 Summer Olympics basketball preliminaries and finals.

Feature.data: Beijing Shooting Range Clay Target Field

speak.value: The Beijing Shooting Range Clay Target Field hosted men's and women's skeet shooting and trap shooting events at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Capital Indoor Stadium hosted volleyball events at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Fengtai Sports Center Softball Field hosted the softball competitions at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Laoshan Mountain Bike Course hosted the mountain bike competitions at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Olympic Sports Center Stadium hosted football matches and the running and riding parts of the modern pentathlon events at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Olympic Sports Center Gymnasium hosted the handball tournaments up to and including the quarter-finals at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Worker's Stadium hosted the football quarter-finals and semi-finals, as well as the women's gold medal final at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Worker's Gymnasium hosted the boxing events at the 2008 Summer Olympics.

Feature.data: Ying Tung Natatorium of National Olympic Sports Center

speak.value: The Ying Tung Natatorium of National Olympic Sports Center hosted water polo matches and the swimming part of the modern pentathlon event at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Chaoyang Park Beach Volleyball Ground was a temporary venue for the beach volleyball matches at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
This venue was a temporary venue for the men's and women's BMX racing events at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Shisanling Reservoir was temporarily used for the Triathlon events at the 2008 Summer Olympics, during which it was known as the Triathlon Venue.
The Urban Road Cycling Course was a temporary venue that started at the North Square of Yongdingmen in Beijing's Chongwen District and ended at Juyong Pass in Changping District.
The Wukesong Sports Center Baseball Field was a temporary venue for baseball events at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Hong Kong Equestrian Venues was located in the Hong Kong Sports Institute, which was taken over and prepared by the Hong Kong Jockey Club in order to make way for the Olympics.
The Qingdao International Sailing Center hosted the Olympic Sailing competitions.
The Qinghuangdao Olympic Sports Center Stadium served as one of the football venues at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Shanghai Stadium was used for the football preliminaries at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Shenyang Olympic Sports Center Stadium hosted football matches at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Tianjin Olympic Center Stadium hosted football preliminaries at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Other Venues were built in Beijing that did not belong to the Olympic Green or any university.
The Olympic Green is an Olympic Park constructed for the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Universities Gymnasiums were venues that belong to universities.
Venues outside Beijing were venues at the 2008 Summer Olympics outside the host city of Beijing.
The Promenade was the park itself that hosted some of the athletic events at the 2008 Games.
The Beijing Olympic Village was an Olympic Village that hosted the attendees, which included competitors and their coaches, at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Digital Beijing Building served as a data center at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Operated by Beijing Olympic Broadcasting, a Ling Long Pagoda has international broadcast studios which offered skyline views as backdrops for Olympic broadcasts.
The Olympic Park Observation Tower is an observation tower whose five circular roofs are meant to evoke the Olympic rings.
Olympic Green Venues are venues that are inside the Olympic Green.
Beibei is a female Fuwa representing Oceania, sea, prosperity, and aquatic sports.
Jingjing is a male Fuwa representing Europe, forest, happiness, and weightlifting and judo sports.
Huanhuan is a male Fuwa representing America, fire, passion, and ball sports and racquet sports.
Yingying is a male Fuwa representing Asia, earth, health, and track and field sports.
Nini is a female Fuwa representing Africa, sky, good fortune, and gymnastics.
Including Beibei, Jingjing, Huanhuan, Yingying and Nini, Fuwa is the mascot of the 2008 Summer Olympics that representing "Beijing welcomes you".
Mascots are people or animals that are adopted by a team or other group as symbolic figures.
Beijing is the city that hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Shanghai is a city that co hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Qingdao is a city that co hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Hong Kong is a city that co hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Qinghuangdao is a city that co hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Tianjin is a city that co hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Shenyang is a city that co hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The Host City is the main city that hosted events.
Co host cities are cities that helped hosting events.
Cities are large and permanent human settlements.
Venues are places where sports events take place.
You and Me is the theme song for the 2008 Summer Olympics, which was performed in the opening ceremony by Liu Huan and Sarah Brightman.
An Anthem is a theme song used to represent a particular gathering.
One World, One Dream is the official motto for the 2008 Summer Olympics, which called upon the whole world to join in the Olympic spirit and build a better future for humanity.
A Motto is a short sentence or phrase that expresses a rule for sensible behaviour, especially a way of behaving in a particular situation.
The Opening Ceremony of the 2008 Summer Olympics was on Aug. 8th, 2008.
The Closing Ceremony of the 2008 Summer Olympics was on Aug. 24th, 2008.
The Opening Ceremony of 2008 Summer Olympics was held on Aug. 8th, 2008.
The Closing Ceremony of 2008 Summer Olympics was held on Aug. 24th, 2008.
The duration of the 2008 Summer Olympics.

Mariel Zagunis is an American sabre fencer that won the gold medals in the individual sabre at the 2004 Summer Olympics and the 2008 Summer Olympics. She is the second American to win a gold medal in Olympic fencing.
Women's Sabre was the women's sabre fencing competition at the 2008 Summer Olympics. It took place on 9 August at the Olympic Green Convention Centre.

Michael Phelps is a competition swimmer and the most decorated Olympian of all time, with a total of 22 medals. At the 2008 Beijing Games, Phelps has won eight gold medals, taking the record for the most first-place finishes at any single Olympics.
The men's 400-meter individual medley event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 9-10 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.
Nathan Adrian is an American competition swimmer and three-time Olympic gold medalist who currently holds the American record in the 50- and 100-yard freestyle events.

Matthew Grevers is a competition swimmer who competes in the backstroke and freestyle events, and is a six-time Olympic medalist. At the 2008 Summer Olympics, Grevers won gold medals as a member of the U.S. teams in the 4x100-meter freestyle and 4x100-meter medley relays, and a silver medal in the 100-meter backstroke.

Cullen Jones is an American competition swimmer and Olympic gold medalist who specializes in freestyle sprint events. As part of the American team, he holds the world record in the 4x100-meter freestyle relay (long course).
Jason Edward Lezak is a competition swimmer who is a four-time Olympic gold medalist.

Garrett Weber-Gale is an American competition swimmer, two-time Olympic gold medalist, and world record-holder in two events. As a member of the U.S. team, he won medals in both 4x100-meter freestyle relay and 4x100-meter medley relay.
Ben Wildman-Tobriner is an American competition swimmer, Olympic gold medalist, and former mens 4x100-meter freestyle relay world record holder.
The men's 4x100-meter freestyle relay event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 10-11 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.
The men's 200-meter freestyle event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 10-12 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.

Natalie Coughlin is an American competition swimmer and twelve-time Olympic medalist. At the 2008 Summer Olympics, she became the first U.S. female athlete in modern Olympic history to win six medals in one Olympiad, and the first woman ever to win a 100-meter backstroke gold in two consecutive Olympics.
The women's 100-meter backstroke event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 1012 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.

Aaron Wells Peirsol is a former competition swimmer and backstroke specialist, former world champion, world record-holder, and a three-time Olympian and seven-time Olympic medievalist. He holds the world record in the mens 100-meter and 200-meter backstroke and the 4x100 meter medley relay.
The men's 100-meter backstroke event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 10-12 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.

Walton Glenn Eller is an American trap shooter and four-time U.S. Olympic athlete (2000, 2004, 2008, 2012). At the 2008 Summer Olympics, he set two Olympic records en route to winning a gold medal in double trap at the Beijing Shooting Range.
The men's double trap event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 12 August at the Beijing Shooting Range Clay Target Field.
The men's 200-meter butterfly event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 11-13 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.

Ricky Berens is an American former competition swimmer, two-time Olympic gold medalist, world champion, and current world record-holder. As a member of the U.S. national team, he holds the world record in the 4x200-meter freestyle relay (long course).
Klete Keller is an American former competition swimmer who won medals at the 2000 Summer Olympics and the 2004 Summer Olympics in the 400-meter freestyle and the 4x200-meter freestyle relay.

Ryan Steven Lochte is a competitive swimmer and an 11-time Olympic medalist. He holds the world record in the 100-meter, 200-meter and 400-meter individual medley competitions, and the 4x200-meter freestyle relay.
Peter Vanderkaay is a former competition swimmer who specialized in middle-distance freestyle events and a four-time Olympic medalist.
Erik Vendt is an American former competition swimmer, who won a gold medal as a member of the U.S. 4x200-meter freestyle relay team at the 2008 Summer Olympics.

David Walters is an American competition swimmer, Olympic gold medalist, and world record-holder in two events. At the 2008 Summer Olympics, Walters earned a gold medal in the 4x200-meter freestyle relay.
The men's 4x200-meter freestyle relay event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 12-13 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.
Kristin Armstrong is a professional road bicycle racer and two-time Olympic gold medalist, the winner of the women's individual time trial in 2008 and 2012.
The women's road time trial at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 13 August at the Urban Road Cycling Course.

Rebecca Soni is a former competition swimmer and breaststroke specialist who is a six-time Olympic medalist. She is a former world record holder in the 100-meter and 200-meter breaststroke events and current 4x100-meter medley relay world record holder.
The women's 200-meter backstroke event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 1416 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.
The men's 200-meter backstroke event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 13-15 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.
The men's 200-meter individual medley event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 11-13 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.
Nastia Liukin is a retired Russian-American artistic gymnast, who is the 2008 Olympic individual all-around champion.
The women's artistic individual all-around competition at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 15 August at the Beijing National Indoor Stadium.
The men's 100-meter butterfly event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 14-16 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.

Vincent Hancock is an American shooter and Olympic athlete who won the gold medal in the men's skeet at the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing and 2012 Summer Olympics in London. He is the first skeet shooter to repeat as the Olympic champion.
The men's skeet event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 15-16 August at the Beijing Shooting Range Clay Target Field.
Ian Crocker is an American former competition swimmer, five-time Olympic medalist, and former 50-meter, 100-meter butterfly and 100-meter freestyle world record-holder.
Mark Gangloff is an American former competition swimmer, Olympic gold medalist and world champion.

Brendan Hansen is an American competition swimmer who specializes in breaststroke events. Hansen is a six-time Olympic medalist, and is also a former world record-holder in both the 100-meter and 200-meter breaststroke (long course).

Garrett Weber-Gale is an American competition swimmer, two-time Olympic gold medalist, and world record-holder in two events. As a member of the U.S. team, he won medals in both 4x100-meter freestyle relay and 4x100-meter medley relay.
The men's 4x100-meter medley relay event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 15 and 17 August at the Beijing National Aquatics Center.

Serena Jameka Williams is currently ranked No. 1 in women's singles tennis. She is the only female player to have won over $60 million in prize money, and is the reigning Australian Open, US Open, WTA Tour Championships and Olympic ladies singles champion.

Venus Ebony Starr Williams is a former World No. 1, the first American black woman to achieve this feat during the Open Era. She is regarded as the best grass court player of her generation and she is widely considered as one of the all-time greats of women's tennis.
The tennis women's doubles event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 10-17 August at the Olympic Green Tennis Center.

Erin Cafaro, an American rower, competed at the 2008 Summer Olympics, where she won a gold medal in women's eight. At the 2012 London Olympics she won her second consecutive gold medal in women's eight.
Anna Cummins is an American rower who won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics and a silver medal at the 2004 Summer Olympics in the women's eight.
Caryn Davies is an American rower, who won gold medals as the stroke seat in women's eight at the 2012 Summer Olympics and the 2008 Summer Olympics.

Susan Francia is an American rower, who has served nine years as a U.S. National Team member and won a Gold Medal with the 2012 Olympic Team in London, England and the 2008 Olympic Team in Beijing, China.
Anna Goodale, an American rower competed at the 2008 Summer Olympics, where she won a gold medal in women's eight.
Caroline Lind is an American rower, and is a two-time Olympic gold medalist. In her Olympic debut at the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing, Lind won a gold medal as a member of the women's eight team.
Elle Logan, an American rower, competed at the 2012 and 2008 Summer Olympics, where she won a gold medal in women's eight in each Olympics.
Lindsay Shoop, an American rower, competed at the 2008 Summer Olympics, where she won a gold medal in women's eight.
Mary Whipple, an American coxswain, won a gold medal in women's eight at both the 2012 Summer Olympics and the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The rowing women's eight competition at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on the 11th (heats), 13th (Repechage) and 17th (Final A) of August, at the Shunyi Olympic Rowing-Canoeing Park.

Stephanie Brown Trafton is an American track and field athlete who won the discus throwing gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing. She is thus one of only two American women to have ever won the event, and the only one since the Great Depression.
The women's discus throw event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 1518 August at the Beijing Olympic Stadium.

Angelo F. Taylor is a track and field athlete, winner of 400-meter hurdles at the 2000 and 2008 Summer Olympics. His personal record for the hurdles event is 47.25 seconds and he has a 400-meter dash best of 44.05 seconds.
The men's 400-meter hurdles event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 16-18 August at the Beijing National Stadium.

Laura Kraut is an American show jumping competitor and Olympic champion. At the 2008 Summer Olympics, Kraut won the gold medal as part of the United States team with her horse Cedric in team jumping, together with McLain Ward, Will Simpson, and Beezie Madden.

Beezie Madden is an American show jumping competitor and Olympic winner. At the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympics, Madden earned gold in the Team Jumping competition along with Laura Kraut, Will Simpson and McLain Ward. She also earned a bronze in the Individual Show Jumping competition.

Will Simpson is an American show jumping competitor and Olympic champion. At the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing, Simpson won the gold medal as part of the United States team in team jumping, together with McLain Ward, Laura Kraut, and Beezie Madden.

McLain Ward is an American show jumping competitor and Olympic champion. He won the team gold for show jumping at the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympics with Laura Kraut (Cedric), Beezie Madden (Authentic), and Will Simpson (Carlson vom Dach) and McLain's horse, Sapphire.
The equestrian team jumping at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 15-18 August, at the Hong Kong Equestrian Venues.

Anna Tunnicliffeis an American sailor and world-class competitor in the women's single-handed (the Laser Radial). As a member of the 2008 US Olympic team she won a gold medal in the Women's Laser Radial class.
The laser radial was a sailing event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 12-19 August at Qingdao International Sailing Center.
Henry Cejudo is an American freestyle wrestler, Olympic gold medalist, mixed martial artist and author. He became an Olympic gold medalist at 21 years old, the youngest American wrestler to do so.
The men's freestyle 55 kg wrestling competition at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 19 August at the China Agricultural University Gymnasium.
Shawn Johnson, a retired American artistic gymnast, is the 2008 Olympic balance beam gold medalist and team, all-around, and floor exercise silver medalist.
Women's balance beam gymnastics competition at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 19 August at the Beijing National Indoor Stadium.

Dawn Harper is an American track and field athlete who specializes in the 100-meter hurdles. She was the gold medalist in the event at the 2008 Beijing Olympics, and the first American 100-meter hurdler to ever win gold at an Olympics and medal in the following Olympics.
The women's 100-meter hurdles at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 1719 August at the Beijing National Stadium.
Misty May-Treanor, a retired American professional beach volleyball player, is a three-time Olympic gold medalist (2004, 2008, 2012).
Kerri Walsh is an American professional beach volleyball player. Walsh Jennings and teammate Misty May-Treanor were the gold medalists in beach volleyball at the 2004, 2008, and 2012 Summer Olympics.
The women's beach volleyball tournament at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 9-21 August at the Chaoyang Park Beach Volleyball Ground.
LaShawn Merritt is a track and field athlete who competes in sprinting events, specializing in the 400-meter. His personal best of 43.74 seconds makes him the fifth fastest of all time.
The men's 400-meter track and field event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 18-21 August at the Beijing National Stadium.
Nicole Barnhart is an American soccer goalkeeper, and a two-time Olympic gold medalist. She is a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Shannon Boxx is an American soccer defensive midfielder and is a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Rachel Buehler is an American soccer defender and is a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Lori Chalupny is an American soccer midfielder and is a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Lauren Cheney is a professional soccer midfield playmaker and forward. She is a two-time Olympic gold medalist as a member of the national team (2008, 2012).
Stephanie Cox is a Mexican-American professional soccer defender, Olympic gold medalist, and current member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Tobin Heath, an American professional soccer player, is a two-time Olympic gold medalist and FIFA Women's World Cup silver medalist who plays for the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Angela Hucles is a retired American professional soccer midfielder and was a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Natasha Kai is an American professional soccer forward and Olympic gold medalist, who is a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.

Carli Lloyd is an American professional soccer midfielder and a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team. She is a two-time Olympic gold medalist and scored the gold medal-winning goals in the finals of both the 2008 Summer Olympics and the 2012 Summer Olympics.
Kate Markgraf, a retired American professional soccer defender, played three times at the Olympics and was a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Heather Mitts, an American former professional soccer defender, is a three-time Olympic gold medalist, and was a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Heather O'Reilly is a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team and a three-time Olympic gold medalist.
Christie Rampone, an American professional soccer defender, is captain of the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Amy Rodriguez is an American soccer player and is also a member of the United States Women's National Soccer Team. She has played most of her games in the forward position and is known to be speedy.
Hope Solo is an American soccer goalkeeper and a two-time Olympic gold medalist. She has been goalkeeping for the United States Women's National Soccer Team since 2000.
Lindsay Tarpley is an American professional soccer forward and midfielder. She is a two-time Olympic gold medalist with the United States Women's National Soccer Team.
Aly Wagner, a retired American soccer midfielder, was a member of the United States women's national soccer team.

Feature.data: United States Women's National Soccer Team

speak.value: The United States Women's National Soccer Team has been one of the most successful in international women's soccer, winning two Women's World Cup titles, four Olympic gold medals, and ten Algarve Cups. It was ranked No. 1 in the FIFA Women's World Rankings continuously from March 2008 to December 2014, and is currently ranked No. 2.

The women's association football tournament at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place in Beijing and four other cities in China on 6-21 August. Associations affiliated with FIFA were invited to send their full women's national teams.
Phil Dalhausser is an American professional beach volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympics.
Todd Rogers is an American professional beach volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympics.
The men's beach volleyball tournament at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 9-22 August at the Chaoyang Park Beach Volleyball Ground.
Bryan Clay is an American decathlete and champion at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The men's decathlon at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 21-22 August at the Beijing National Stadium.
Kerron Clement is a track and field athlete who competes in the 400-meter hurdles and 400-meter sprint, who took the silver at the 2008 Beijing Olympics.
David Neville is an American sprinter specializing in the 400-meter. He won a gold medal in men's 4x400-meter relay and a bronze medal in Men's 400-meter at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Jeremy Wariner is an American track athlete specializing in the 400-meter. He won the 4x400-meter relay gold medal and the silver medal in men's 400-meter at the 2008 Beijing Olympics.
Reggie Witherspoon was part of the U.S. men's 4x400-meter relay team and won a gold medal at the 2008 Beijing Olympics.
The men's 4x400-meter relay event at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 22-23 August at the Beijing National Stadium.
Allyson Felixis is member of the U.S. women's 4x400-meter relay team and won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Natasha Hastings is member of the U.S. womens 4x400-meter relay team and won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Monique Henderson is member of the U.S. womens 4x400-meter relay team and won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics.

Sanya Richards is member of the U.S. womens 4x400-meter relay team and won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics. She has been the best 400-meter runner in the world in the past decade, ranking No. 1 in the world from 2005-2009 and again in 2012.
Mary Wineberg is member of the U.S. womens 4x400-meter relay team and won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
The women's 4x400-meter relay at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 22-23 August at the Beijing Olympic Stadium.

Seimone Augustus is an American professional basketball player in the WNBA, currently playing for the Minnesota Lynx, Dynamo Kursk and the US National Team. She and her teammates of the 2008 Olympic basketball team won an Olympic gold in the women's tournament.
Sue Bird is an American-Israeli professional women's basketball player. She was invited to be on the 2008 Olympic basketball team and won the gold medal in the women's tournament.
Tamika Catchings, an American professional basketball player, won an Olympic gold in the women's tournament as a member of the 2008 Olympic basketball team.
Sylvia Fowles, an American professional basketball player, won an Olympic gold in the women's tournament as a member of the 2008 Olympic basketball team.
Kara Lawson is an American professional women's basketball player, who primarily plays as a shooting guard and won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Lisa Leslie is an American former professional women's basketball player who won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics and played in the WNBA.
DeLisha Milton-Jones is an American professional basketball player. She participated in the 2008 Summer Olympics and won a gold medal in the women's basketball tournament.
Candace Parker is an American professional basketball player. She participated in the 2008 Summer Olympics and won a gold medal in the women's basketball tournament.
Cappie Pondexter is an American professional basketball player. She and her teammates of the 2008 Summer Olympic basketball team won an Olympic gold in the women's tournament.
Katie Smith is a retired American professional basketball player. As a member of the 2008 Summer Olympic basketball team, she won an Olympic gold in the women's tournament.
Diana Taurasiis an American professional basketball player, who won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Tina Thompson is a retired American professional basketball player, who participated in the 2008 Summer Olympics and won a gold medal in the women's basketball tournament.

Feature.data: United States Women's National Basketball Team

speak.value: The United States Women's National Basketball Team has won seven Olympic gold medals and nine FIBA world championships. The team is composed of some of the top American players in the WNBA and the women's college game.
The women's basketball tournament at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 9-23 August at the Wukesong Indoor Stadium.
Lloy Ball is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Gabe Gardner is an American professional volleyball player, who is a two time Olympian, having played at the 2004 Athens Olympics and 2008 Summer Olympics with the U.S. national team.
Kevin Hansen is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Tom Hoff is an American volleyball player and three-time Olympian in volleyball Olympics: 2000, 2004 and 2008.
Rich Lambourne is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
David Lee is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Ryan Millar is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Reid Priddy is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Sean Rooney is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Riley Salmon is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Clay Stanley is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Scott Touzinsky is an American volleyball player and gold medalist at the 2008 Summer Olympics.

Feature.data: United States Men's National Volleyball Team

speak.value: The United States Men's National Volleyball Team, governed by USA Volleyball, takes part in international competitions such as the Summer Olympics and the FIVB World League.
The men's tournament in volleyball at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 10-24 August at Capital Indoor Stadium and Beijing Institute of Technology Gymnasium.

Carmelo Anthony is an American professional basketball player, who has been a member of the United States Olympic Men's National Team three times, winning a bronze medal at the 2004 Olympics and gold medals at the 2008 and 2012 Olympics.
Carlos Boozer is an American professional basketball player, who has won an Olympic bronze medal at the 2004 Summer Olympics and an Olympic gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Chris Bosh is an American professional basketball player, who has won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Kobe Bryant is an American professional basketball player. At the 2008 and 2012 Summer Olympics, he won gold medals as a member of the U.S. National Team.
Dwight Howard is an American professional basketball player, who won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics as a member of the U.S. National Team.
LeBron James is an American professional basketball player, who has won two Olympic gold medals, one in 2008 and the other in 2012.
Jason Kidd is a retired American professional basketball player and was a two-time Olympic Gold Medal winner during his professional career, as part of Team USA in 2000 and 2008.
Chris Paul is an American professional basketball player, who won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics as a member of the U.S. National Team.
Tayshaun Prince is an American professional basketball player, who won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics as a member of the U.S. National Team.
Michael Redd is a former professional basketball player, who won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics as a member of the U.S. National Team.
Dwyane Wade is an American professional basketball player. At the 2008 Summer Olympics, Wade led the United States Men's Basketball Team and won a gold medal.
Deron Williams is an American professional basketball player, who won gold medals at the 2008 and 2012 Summer Olympics as a member of the U.S. National Team.

Feature.data: United States Men's National Basketball Team

speak.value: The United States Men's National Basketball Team represents the U.S. in international men's basketball, and has won medals in all seventeen Olympic tournaments it has entered, among which fourteen golds.
The men's Tournament of Basketball at the 2008 Summer Olympics took place on 10-24 August at the Wukesong Indoor Stadium.

Founded in 1894 and headquartered in Colorado Springs, the United States Olympic Committee (USOC) is the National Olympic Committee for the United States.
